page.description: If the grid is editable and the control type is editable, you may optionally suppress editing of the field that you view through the control. You may also set a minimum security level required to change the field's contents.

description.p: Specify if the field can be edited.
If you want to be able to type text in the field, but still not update any table when the Grid is submitted, set 'Updateable' to true, and set the 'Table Alias' property to:

section.title: Blank is NULL
section.important: This option can only be used if the database allows the field to be nullable.

section.title: Security level
section.description: Specify the minimum Security Level required to update this field. If all users can update this field regardless of their Security Level, set the Security Level to 0.

section.title: Security Groups
section.description: Select which security groups can update this field. If no groups are selected, all users can update this field.

description.p: Specify the table alias for the field.
If this field is not bound to a table, enter the following:

section.title: Field to update
section.description: Specify the name of the field in the table that is updated.

description.p: When updating records, if 'Check for write conflicts' is turned on, should this field be included in the section of fields that are checked for write conflicts?
If the data type for a field precludes it from being used in a WHERE clause with an = operator, the field is automatically excluded from write conflict checking.

note.p: In some older versions of Alpha Anywhere, check for write conflicts must be manually disabled if the type for the field cannot be used in a WHERE clause (which is what is required in order to use a field in a write conflict check.) For example, the 'ntext' type in SQL Server.

description.p: When an update, or insert is performed, the location value in this field can automatically be computed from the longitude and latitude value from the fields that contain these values.
